text: Novaya Zemlya's west coast as depicted in De Veer's diary Gerrit de Veer (–) was a Dutch officer on Willem Barentsz' second and third voyages of 1595 and 1596 respectively, in search of the Northeast passage. De Veer kept a diary of the voyages and in 1597, was the first person to observe and record the Novaya Zemlya effect, and the first Westerner to observe hypervitaminosis A caused by consumption of the liver of a polar bear.The New England Journal of Medicine : Hypervitaminosis A and Fractures == References == Category:16th-century Dutch explorers Category:Dutch diarists Category:Dutch polar explorers Category:Explorers of Svalbard Category:Explorers of the Arctic
title: Gerrit de Veer
